div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: Last week, our teachers and staff began working remotely to plan and prepare for the launch of distance learning. We also distributed technology devices to families in grades TK-2 who did not have a device at their homes with an older sibling. If your family does not have a district issued Chromebook at home, please contact your school through the Let’s Talk App on the district website or mobile application using a computer or phone. For right now, we are unable to issue an individual device to every student.

This week, we began our “soft launch” of distance learning. Teachers, Principals and staff have been reaching out to students and families through various means including email, phone calls, and Google Classroom and Google Meet. If you have not heard from your child’s teacher or the school, please contact your school using the Let’s Talk app or by emailing your School Principal.
We are excited to have launched a new school closure website for families, which contains valuable information, technology tutorials, resources, and Frequently Asked Questions.

Starting Monday, April 20, Distance Learning will be fully underway. We will be offering continued learning for all students, including class meetings, assignments and lessons, and independent work opportunities. In addition, our VAPA/STEM teachers will be providing enrichment opportunities for students in the arts and science. Special education staff will be working with students and families to ensure all learners are supported appropriately.
With school campuses closed to staff and the public, it is important to ensure communication with families. We encourage you to use the Let’s Talk app to contact school and District staff.
Students, please work hard to continue with your learning and be sure to keep reading, and reading, and reading. There is nothing more important for your future than a great education.
We hope that your family is safe and well during this difficult time. We miss you!

span.p: South Bay Union Bulk Meal Distribution on Mondays from 11:00-1:00 at the District Warehouse (1111 Saturn Blvd.). In order to receive meals you must have your children with you or provide proof of identity of your child in the form of a student ID, birth certificate or other document. We will accept copies or pictures of the identity documents.
